title: I get BugSplat after latest windows update
body: I have literally been getting a bugsplat after the windows 10 update. I completely Redid my computer thinking it was some type of virus i had gotten, but after reinstalling windows the game worked. I was like cool! so i updated my computer to the latest windows updates, and bam, bugsplatting again. Is there any sort of fix for this, is no one else getting this problem??????? I cant believe this hasnt been patched yet if so.

replies.body:
i finaly fixed it !!!!
i hope this works for you guys
-type "xbox" in your windows search
-click on it and sign up if you have to
-when you are in the xbox app click on the settings (the gear thingy) in the app 
-go to dvr games
-disable the dvr recording thing
after that just go in to a custom game and try if it works 
seems like after the windows update the recording dvr thing was automaticly on and messed up with league files or something 
hope i was helpful :)

This is what I got about bugsplat after champ select from tech support, also said to temporarily uninstall  anti-virus programs,
 ) These issues can be caused by a recent Windows 10 Anniversary update. This update made some changes to the Xbox service and enabled " DVR (game recording)" by default. Whether or not players have used this in the past, it would be in their best interest to double check that this is turned off. To turn off the Game DVR feature in the Windows 10, please do the following:

Open the Xbox app by going to the Search bar on the bottom left of the screen and typing "Xbox"
Click on the Settings (Gear) icon on the left.
Click on Game DVR at the top.
Click on the On/Off (switch) under "Record game clips and screenshots using Game DVR" to turn it off. (it should be gray and set to "Off")

You might have some outdated drivers or game file issues causing this bugsplat, so it's important to get those tuned up as your first step.  I suggest using our [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) to get this fixed up!  Hopefully, this will do the trick but let me know if you have any questions!
